intro: Cephalaria syriaca var. boissieri, commonly known as the Syrian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is typically found in rocky or dry habitats. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
